content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good and interesting

Nice clash, I tested it in Reverse conditions and it's solvable in 5 minutes.

Only issue is that your statement never mentions that "positive" and "negative" characters refer to "+" and "-", respectively. If you add a note explaining this or even just brackets (+) and (-) next to those words, then I can approve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good Clash.
I'm also quite new to coding
I have revised the statement and test cases. If any other feedback, I'll gladly take it as this is my first codingame problem.

Some remarks:
- Currently there is only a 'nonsense' in one test (test 5), but not in the validators. Reverse players that submit code with only 'attracts' and 'repels' based on the first four tests will not be punished.
- Actually, your test 5 requires output 'nonsense', but the option of output 'nonsense' is not described anywhere.
-Your constraints are incorrect. It states only + and - is given, but test 5 gives other characters.
- Usually, the statement itself already contains the task description. With this contribution, reading the statement is 'a waste of my time'. I suggest rephrasing to something like "...either positive ({{+}}) or negative ({{-}}). Create a piece of code that deciphers the effect of the interaction, which can be one of {{attracts}} when different charges are present, {{repels}} when all charges are the same, or {{nonsense}} if the effect output contains other characters."
As soon as the changes in the statement are made, I think I'll validate the proposal.

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for all clashes. Currently there are only two possible answers in this clash ("attracts" / "repels"), hence it suffers from a binary output issue. Please revise the output requirement so that there are more than 2 possible answers in total.

Goal
* Please add "{{+}}" after "positive". (Note that {{ }} is the syntax for constants.)

* Please add "{{-}}" after "negative".

Input
* Next N lines: Please delete "separated by commas". You haven't put any commas in the input.

Output
* Please format "attacts" and "repels" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Thanks.

We won't receive any notifications of your replies if you don't reply to our comments directly. Please reply directly next time.

The current contribution looks better now. But for Reverse mode to work, you still need to add at least one more pair of cases, something similar to Validator 4, so that the players can better guess what cases there are.

Also, for easier checking, it's better to group similar cases in pairs, e.g. the two "nonsense" cases should be grouped as a pair.

Thanks.

Actually it's better for you to move around and group the tests and validators in pairs so that it's easier to check whether your contribution has achieved similar coverage, e.g.

* Test 1 and Test 2 are a pair (and become New Test 1 and New Validator 1).

* Validator 1 and Validator 2 are a pair (and become New Test 2 and New Validator 2).

* Test 3 and Test 7 are a pair (and become New Test 3 and New Validator 3).

* Test 4 and Validator 7 are a pair (and … you get the idea).

* Validator 4 and Validator 5 are a pair.

* Test 5 and Test 6 are a pair.

* Validator 3 does not form any pair. Another similar case should be created to pair with it.

* Validator 6 does not form any pair. Another similar case should be created to pair with it.

Please swap the cases and create the new cases as mentioned above.

Thanks.
